a.title: Documents, Photos, Videos and Web Links
a.span: Documents, Photos, Videos and Web Links

strong.span: WCHS Seniors Cap and Gown Pick Up (4/20/2020)

br.a: Cap and Gown Pick up SPA

span.strong: All Webster City Schools Will Remain Physically Closed For The Rest of The 2019-2020 School

br.span: Gov. Reynolds has announced all Iowa schools will remain physically closed for the rest of the 2019-2020 school year. Online learning will continue until June 3rd

span.strong: Dr. Ross's Letter on School Closure
Dr Ross's Video About School Closures

span.span: Click here for the letter to Middle School parents
Due to increased health recommendations the backpack program is suspended until schools reopen
Click here for the letter to High School parents
All Webster City Schools playgrounds are now closed to help prevent to spread on the coronavirus. Click here for more information

hr.p: Beginning Monday, April 13, five days of meals will be distributed TWO days per week, on Mondays and Thursdays, to the same two pickup locations; Middle School and Northeast Hamilton Sites. Pick up times will remain the same 11:00am - Noon on both days. The pickup on Monday will include lunches for Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday, and the pickup on Thursday will include lunches for Thursday and Friday. The reduction in pickup days is to minimize the number of times families and students need to go outside to pick up meals.

A partir del lunes 13 de abril, cinco días de comidas se distribuirán DOS días por semana, los lunes y jueves, a los mismos dos lugares de recogida; Escuelas intermedias y sitios del noreste de Hamilton. Los horarios de recogida serán los mismos de 11:00 am a mediodía en ambos días. La recolección el lunes incluirá almuerzos para los lunes, martes y miércoles, y la recolección el jueves incluirá almuerzos para los jueves y viernes. La reducción en los días de recolección es para minimizar la cantidad de veces que las familias y los estudiantes necesitan salir para recoger las comidas.

span.strong: Student Activities and Resources While at Home

span.span: WCCS teachers have prepared activities and resources to help students at home during the coronaviris closure. These activities are not required for students to do or complete.

strong.span: Elementary Activities Packet and Belongings Pickup (Updated 4/22/2020)

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Elementary teachers from Northeast Hamilton, Sunset Heights, and Pleasant View have collected students’ belongings from their classrooms. Each student has a bag of their belongings that can be picked up in the parking lot at their elementary school on Thursday, April 23 from 5:00PM-6:30PM. Families may also pick up the weekly activity sheets for their child at the same time.

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; text-align: center;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;
span.span: Los maestros de las escuelas primarias de Northeast Hamilton, Sunset Heights y Pleasant View han recogido las pertenencias de los estudiantes de cada aula en la escuela. Cada estudiante tiene una bolsa de sus pertenencias que puede recoger en el estacionamiento de su escuela primaria el jueves 23 de abril de 5:00 p.m. a 6:30 p.m. Las familias también pueden recoger las hojas de actividades (tarea) para sus hijos en la misma fecha a la misma hora.

The April 4th ACT testing date has been postponed to June 13th. If you signed up for the April testing date you should be getting an email from ACT on transfering your enrollment to the June date. For more information click here

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span:
Infinite Campus provides a web based portal for both parents/guardians and students. The Campus Portal provides a central
website that allows parent/guardians and students to see family information, food accounts, student schedules, grades,
attendance, and school messages. While the Campus Portal provides much of the same information to both parents/guardians

br.span: and students, the portal accounts are slightly different. Parent /guardian portal accounts allow the parent/guardian to access
information on all the students in their household. Student portal accounts only allow the student to see their individual

strong.a: Sign up for a Campus Portal Parent Account

div.p: Need help finding your your way to the Administration Office or one of our schools? Click here for a map of all our locations.

div.h2: Early out, Late start, Cancellation Information
div.p: For early out, late start, and or cancellation announcements please listen to KQWC radio at 95.7 FM or 1570 AM or watch KCCI TV, WHO TV, WOI TV, and or Channel 18/117.3

h3.span: Continuous and Annual Notice of Nondiscrimination

span.style: font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial; color: #c0c0c0; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial; color: #c0c0c0; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 8pt; font-family: Arial; color: #c0c0c0; background-color: transparent; font-weight: bold; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

font-size: 6pt; font-family: Arial; color: #c0c0c0; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

span.span: It is the policy of the Webster City Community School District not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity, and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact the District’s Equity Coordinator, Dr. Mandy Ross, Webster City Community School District, 820 Des Moines Street, Webster City, IA 50595, Phone: 515-832-9200, email address: mandy_ross@webstercity.k12.ia.us.

span.style: font-size: 6pt; font-family: Arial; color: #c0c0c0; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

br.span:
The Webster City Community School District offers career and technical programs in the following areas of study
Agricultural, Food, and Natural Resources

span.style: font-size: 6pt; font-family: Arial; color: #c0c0c0; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

br.span: It is the policy of the Webster City Community School District not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity, and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact the District’s Equity Coordinator, Dr. Mandy Ross, Webster City Community School District, 820 Des Moines Street, Webster City, IA 50595, Phone: 515-832-9200, email address: mandy_ross@webster-city.k12.ia.us.
